content.text:
A few things I learned about today that may be of note: there's an editor framework called [slate](https://github.com/ianstormtaylor/slate) which has a similar schema based on the DOM (sans HTML). They have great docs, and when reading about their [schemas](https://docs.slatejs.org/guides/schemas) and [data model](https://docs.slatejs.org/guides/data-model) I was reminded of atjson.

It looks like both JS and the DOM may already have ways of making cross-boundary selections (e.g. "h1 and half the first paragraph"? This is news to me, but I'm excited that this problem can be tackled in a few different ways.
